16  package com.okta.sdk.impl.ds.cache;
17  
18  import com.okta.sdk.cache.Cache;
19  import com.okta.sdk.impl.ds.CacheMapInitializer;
20  import com.okta.sdk.impl.ds.DefaultCacheMapInitializer;
21  import com.okta.sdk.impl.ds.DefaultResourceFactory;
22  import com.okta.sdk.impl.ds.FilterChain;
23  import com.okta.sdk.impl.ds.ResourceAction;
24  import com.okta.sdk.impl.ds.ResourceDataRequest;
25  import com.okta.sdk.impl.ds.ResourceDataResult;
26  import com.okta.sdk.impl.http.CanonicalUri;
27  import com.okta.sdk.impl.resource.AbstractInstanceResource;
28  import com.okta.sdk.impl.resource.AbstractResource;
29  import com.okta.sdk.impl.resource.ArrayProperty;
30  import com.okta.sdk.impl.resource.Property;
31  import com.okta.sdk.impl.resource.ReferenceFactory;
32  import com.okta.sdk.impl.resource.ResourceReference;
33  import com.okta.sdk.impl.util.BaseUrlResolver;
34  import com.okta.sdk.lang.Assert;
35  import com.okta.sdk.lang.Collections;
36  import com.okta.sdk.resource.CollectionResource;
37  import com.okta.sdk.resource.Resource;
38  import javafx.beans.property.SetProperty;
39  
40  import java.lang.reflect.Field;
41  import java.util.ArrayList;
42  import java.util.Collection;
43  import java.util.List;
44  import java.util.Map;
45  
46  public class WriteCacheFilter extends AbstractCacheFilter {
47  
48      private final BaseUrlResolver baseUrlResolver;
49      private final ReferenceFactory referenceFactory;
50      private final CacheMapInitializer cacheMapInitializer;
51  
52  
53      public WriteCacheFilter(BaseUrlResolver baseUrlResolver, CacheResolver cacheResolver, boolean collectionCachingEnabled, ReferenceFactory referenceFactory) {
54          super(cacheResolver, collectionCachingEnabled);
55          Assert.notNull(referenceFactory, "referenceFactory cannot be null.");
56          Assert.notNull(baseUrlResolver, "baseUrlResolver cannot be null.");
57          this.referenceFactory = referenceFactory;
58          this.cacheMapInitializer = new DefaultCacheMapInitializer();
59          this.baseUrlResolver = baseUrlResolver;
60      }
61  
62      @Override
63      public ResourceDataResult filter(ResourceDataRequest request, FilterChain chain) {
64  
65          if (request.getAction() == ResourceAction.DELETE) {
66              String key = getCacheKey(request);
67              uncache(key, request.getResourceClass());
68          }
69  
70          ResourceDataResult result = chain.filter(request);
71  
72          if (isCacheable(request, result)) {
73              cache(result.getResourceClass(), result.getData(), result.getUri());
74          }
75  
76          return result;
77      }
78  
79      private boolean isCacheable(ResourceDataRequest request, ResourceDataResult result) {
80  
81          if (Collections.isEmpty(result.getData())) {
82              return false;
83          }
84  
85          Class<? extends Resource> clazz = result.getResourceClass();
86  
87          return
88              //@since 0.5.0
89              AbstractResource.isMaterialized(result.getData());
90      }
91  
92  
93      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
94      private void cache(Class<? extends Resource> clazz, Map<String, ?> data, CanonicalUri uri) {
95  
96          Assert.notEmpty(data, "Resource data cannot be null or empty.");
97          String href = uri.getAbsolutePath();
98  
99          if (isDirectlyCacheable(clazz, data)) {
100             Assert.notNull(href, "Resource data must contain an 'href' attribute.");
101             Assert.isTrue(data.size() > 1, "Resource data must be materialized to be cached " +
102                     "(need more than just an 'href' attribute)."); // TODO: this likely is not valid for Okta
103         }
104 
105         //create a map to reflect the resource's canonical representation - this is what will be cached:
106         Map<String, Object> cacheValue = cacheMapInitializer.initialize(clazz, data, uri.getQuery());
107 
108         for (Map.Entry<String, ?> entry : data.entrySet()) {
109 
110             String name = entry.getKey();
111             Object value = entry.getValue();
112 
113             if (value instanceof Map) {
114 
115                 Map<String, ?> nested = (Map<String, ?>) value;
116 
117                 if (AbstractResource.isMaterialized(nested) && false) { // FIXME: cannot cache submodels yet
118                     //If there is more than one attribute (more than just 'href') it is not just a simple reference
119                     //anymore - it has been materialized to its full set of attributes.  Because we have a full
120                     //materialized resource, we need to recursively cache it (and any of its referenced materialized
121                     //resources) and so on.
122 
123                     //find the type of object this attribute name represents:
124                     Property property = getPropertyDescriptor(clazz, name);
125                     Assert.isTrue(property instanceof ResourceReference,
126                                   "It is expected that only ResourceReference properties are complex objects.");
127 
128                     //cache this materialized reference:
129                     //we pass 'null' in as the querystring param because the querystring is only valid for
130                     //the top-most item being cached - we don't want to propagate it for nested resources because the nested
131                     //resource wasn't acquired w/ that query string.
132                     cache(property.getType(), nested, null);
133 
134                     //Because the materialized reference has now been cached, we don't need to store
135                     //all of its properties again in the 'toCache' instance.  Instead, we just want to store
136                     //an unmaterialized reference (a Map with just the 'href' attribute).
137                     //If the a caller attempts to materialize the reference, we will hit the cached version and
138                     //use that data instead of issuing a request.
139                     value = toCanonicalReference(name, nested);
140                 }
141             } else if (value instanceof Collection && name.equals("items") && data.get("href") != null) { //array property, i.e. the 'items' collection resource property
142                 Collection c = (Collection) value;
143                 //Create a new collection that has only references, recursively caching any materialized references:
144                 List list = new ArrayList(c.size());
145 
146                 //if the values in the collection are materialized, we need to cache that materialized reference.
147                 //If the value is not materialized, we don't do anything.
148 
149                 //find the type of objects this collection contains:
150                 Property property = getPropertyDescriptor(clazz, name);
151 
152                 boolean isCollection = property instanceof ArrayProperty;
153 
154                 Assert.isTrue(isCollection, "It is expected that only ArrayProperty or SetProperty properties represent collection items.");
155 
156 //                Property itemsProperty = ArrayProperty.class.cast(property);
157 //                Class itemType = itemsProperty.getType();
158 
159                 for (Object o : c) {
160                     Object element = o;
161                     if (o instanceof Map) {
162                         Map referenceData = (Map) o;
163                         if (AbstractResource.isMaterialized(referenceData)) {
164                             //we pass 'null' in as the querystring param because the querystring is only valid for
165                             //the top-most item being cached - we don't want to propagate it for nested resources because the nested
166                             //resource wasn't acquired w/ that query string.
167 //                            cache(itemType, referenceData, null); // TODO: we cannot cache anything with a null url
168                             element = toCanonicalReference(null, referenceData);
169                         }
170                     }
171                     list.add(element);
172                 }
173 
174                 value = list;
175             }
176         }
177 
178         if (isDirectlyCacheable(clazz, cacheValue)) {
179             Cache cache = getCache(clazz);
180             String cacheKey = getCacheKey(href, uri.getQuery(), clazz);
181             cache.put(cacheKey, cacheValue);
182         }
183     }
184 
185 
186     private Map<String,?> toCanonicalReference(String name, Map<String,?> resourceData) {
187 
188         //If the resource data reflects a materialized instance resource (not a collection resource), we can convert it
189         //to a link since it will cached in shared cache.  This way any time the link is resolved (across any
190         //collection), the same shared cache instance data will be returned, instead of potentially having different
191         //representations of the same resource in different collections.
192         if (AbstractInstanceResource.isInstanceResource(resourceData)) {
193             return this.referenceFactory.createReference(name, resourceData);
194         }
195 
196         //Collections are not yet placed in the shared cache due to the significant challenge of coherency, so we
197         // don't want to 'lose' the fidelity of the collection's properties by converting it to just a link.  So
198         // we return the actual collection:
199         return resourceData;
200     }
201 
202     private <T extends Resource> Property getPropertyDescriptor(Class<T> clazz, String propertyName) {
203 //        clazz = SubtypeDispatchingResourceFactory.getImplementationClass(clazz, propertyName); // FIXME
204 
205         Map<String, Property> descriptors = getPropertyDescriptors(clazz);
206         return descriptors.get(propertyName);
207     }
208 
209     @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
210     private <T extends Resource> Map<String, Property> getPropertyDescriptors(Class<T> clazz) {
211         Class<T> implClass = DefaultResourceFactory.getImplementationClass(clazz);
212         String propertyDescriptors = "PROPERTY_DESCRIPTORS";
213         Map<String, Property> returnValue;
214         try {
215             Field field = implClass.getDeclaredField(propertyDescriptors);
216             field.setAccessible(true);
217             returnValue = (Map<String, Property>) field.get(null);
218             while(implClass.getSuperclass() != null && Resource.class.isAssignableFrom(implClass)){
219                 implClass = (Class<T>) implClass.getSuperclass();
220                 try{
221                     field = implClass.getDeclaredField(propertyDescriptors);
222                     field.setAccessible(true);
223                     returnValue.putAll((Map<String, Property>) field.get(null));
224                 }
225                 catch(NoSuchFieldException nsfe){
226                     // It is not guaranteed that PROPERTY_DESCRIPTORS is part of every super class of the type resource.
227                 }
228             }
229             return returnValue;
230         } catch (Exception e) {
231             throw new IllegalStateException(
232                 "Unable to access PROPERTY_DESCRIPTORS static field on implementation class " + clazz.getName(), e);
233         }
234     }
235 
236     /**
237      * Quick fix for <a href="https://github.com/stormpath/stormpath-sdk-java/issues/17">Issue #17</a>.
238      *
239      */
240     private boolean isDirectlyCacheable(Class<? extends Resource> clazz, Map<String, ?> data) {
241 
242         return AbstractResource.isMaterialized(data) &&
243                (!CollectionResource.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz) ||
244                 (CollectionResource.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz) && isCollectionCachingEnabled()));
245     }
246 
247     @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
248     private void uncache(String cacheKey, Class<? extends Resource> resourceType) {
249         Assert.hasText(cacheKey, "cacheKey cannot be null or empty.");
250         Assert.notNull(resourceType, "resourceType cannot be null.");
251         Cache<String, Map<String, ?>> cache = getCache(resourceType);
252         cache.remove(cacheKey);
253     }
254 }
